text: [Music]
it is too late to be listening to Jordan
shot oh it's an air-conditioner hi
everyone Anthony Fantino here
intranets busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review Space Ghost perp
mysterious funk The Chronicles of Space
Ghost
perp this guy is a young Miami rapper
and producer he got a hefty amount of
buzz last year off of some production
and some verses that he laid into ASAP
Rocky's Live Love ASAP and he had his
own release last year that got him quite
a bit of attention to kind of a free
album slash mixtape that I didn't really
care for all that much but undeniably
kind of had its its own style the sounds
on this thing are really dark lo-fi
gritty kind of Spacey kind of weird to
the point where it actually you know
makes me rethink his lyrics a little bit
because they are kind of simple and it
just makes me wonder is is he trying to
be as lowbrow as possible with track
titles like take that dick suck a dick
for 2011 grind on me and get your head
bust a lot of these older tracks are
actually believed or not on this new
album but the production has been
touched up a little bit to kind of bring
out Space Ghost
perps darkside like I said I didn't
really care for his stuff the first time
around but the production serves as kind
of a saving grace for the second time
around because it does make some of
these tracks sound pretty eerie
revisiting the track get you head bust I
have a completely different feel with
the song the very atmosphere can just
reverb soaked rhythms and the murky
synths and and Space Ghost
perps very whisper quiet flow that has a
very light rasp on it it just feels like
he's going to creep up behind me at any
second with a baseball bat and kind of
take me out
the amount of space surrounding perps
beats and and his his flow he gets a lot
of comparisons to cloud rap artists like
ASAP Rocky and little B and I would say
that comparison is legitimate to the
extent that Space Ghost perp is much
darker and that really dark approach and
his Southern roots have kind of landed
him a lot of three 6 mafia comparisons
which I can also kind of agree with to
an extent I could definitely see
parallels between mysterious funk and
1995's mystic styles of course the beats
on this thing are more modern which is
one separator but another separator
between those two releases and this is
not a good thing the darkness on this
thing feels really forced and why is
that because Space Ghost perp doesn't
rap about anything dark the closest he
comes doing that is maybe on the song
paranoid and kind of the opening track
to where he raps about being kind of a
spiteful sort of hateful individual
who's broken and lives in a cold world
where you can't trust anybody because
everyone's fake he dropped this cool
line about shedding blood tears as they
spell your name you the opening track
has a really basic flow and is not the
most lyrically dense or the most poetic
song in the world but it paints a more
unique picture than the rest of the
tracks on here which pretty much just
Muse about money hoes dick [ __ ]
violence haters which is becoming a more
and more annoying subject to listen to
when it comes to hip-hop music in
today's day and age to be completely
honest lyrically this album is just
really one-dimensional
it's just boring and of course it does
not help that most of the songs on here
don't really have a topic or a direction
or a point and when a lyric doesn't
actually stick out in a song it is
pretty much only because it makes me
cringe like this one line where he's
going to be marrying music it sounds
really cool like ASAP Rocky and
definitely has its own kind of style but
it's extremely weak lyrically but what
kind of makes me favor ASAP Rocky a bit
over purp is that perps words don't even
really fit with the aesthetic or the the
sound he's trying to push I think this
album would be almost fantastic if most
of the songs on your had some
legitimately dark lyrics but instead you
just kind of get this run-of-the-mill
rap wolf dressed in dark and moody and
tortured sheep's clothing I'm really
kind of feeling strong five to a light
six on this thing it's not terrible you
know it's not the worst thing I've heard
all year it's not even close to the
worst hip-hop out my firt all year but I
can't help but listen to this and just
feel like man potential squander what
did you guys think of this thing did you
love it did you hate it why what should
i review next and well yeah that's about
it I love you and hope you're having a
good day
Anthony Fantana Space Ghost perp forever
[Music]
